alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Duval County through 300 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Caroline, or 7 miles north of Unf. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Unf, Neptune Beach, Craig Field, San Pablo, Little Talbot Island and Fort Caroline. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
